intro: Oxytropis gaudinii subsp. pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean oxytropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in early summer, which are typically arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Native to the Pyrenees Mountains, it thrives in rocky and alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
